titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Shizuko Yamamoto Papers MSS.235
titlestmt.author: Jasmine Larkin

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-20 17:05:44 -0400.

physdesc.extent: in 26 record cartons, 7 card boxes, 2 manuscript boxes, 1 flat box, and 1 flat file folder.

did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
did.abstract: The collection consists of materials Shizuko Yamamoto created and gathered throughout her career as a shiatsu practitioner and macrobiotic specialist. Materials include research files, notebooks, conference and workshop packets, photographs, correspondence, recipes, clippings, books, magazines, pamphlets, patient files, audio and video recordings. The collection primarily consists of Yamamoto's books and research files pertaining to shiatsu, macrobiotics, yoga, and alternative, non-Western healing methods. The materials date from 1965 to 2010.
did.langmaterial: Materials primarily in English, with some materials in Japanese.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Kezia Snyder in 2009; an additional accession was donated in 2011. The accession numbers associated with these gifts are 2009.235 and 2011.235.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Shizuko Yamamoto Papers; MSS 235; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Series IV: Patient Files contain sensitive data, and researchers should contact fales.library@nyu.edu for more information. The remainder of the collection is open without restrictions.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Shizuko Yamamoto was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact fales.library@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Shizuko Yamamoto is a well-known shiatsu practitioner and macrobiotic consultant. In her native country of Japan, Yamamoto studied alternative and non-Western healing methods including shiatsu, seitai, yoga, and macrobiotics. After living in Tokyo for 40 years she moved to New York in order to share her knowledge of and promote macrobiotic and shiatsu practices. During her time in the United States, Yamamoto worked as a macrobiotic chef for Gloria Swanson and several macrobiotic restaurants. She provided shiatsu treatments in combination with macrobiotic diet recommendations and guidance to clients suffering from various ailments. Yamamoto is the founder of the International Macrobiotic Shiatsu Society, and served as president of the Macrobiotic Center of New York from 1970 to 1990. She also taught shiatsu and macrobiotic seminars across the United States and Europe. Yamamoto is the author of several books, including Barefoot Shiatsu,The Shiatsu Handbook, andWhole Health Shiatsu.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has been organized into four series: Series I: Research Files; Series II: Books and Magazines; Series III: Correspondence and Photographs; Series IV: Patient Files.
The contents of each series have not been physically arranged by an archivist and the materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was arranged into series based on the original order of the materials as maintained by Shizuko Yamamoto. Materials were placed in archival folders and boxes. Original folder titles were retained when available. In most cases, where folder titles were missing, the archivist's interpretation is enclosed in square brackets. Some materials were shifted between boxes to correct over- or understuffing, but in all cases the original order of the materials was maintained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of materials Yamamoto created and gathered throughout her career as a shiatsu practitioner and macrobiotic specialist. The collection primarily consists of Yamamoto's research files, books, and magazines pertaining to shiatsu, macrobiotics, yoga, and alternative, non-Western healing methods. A small portion of the research files contain commercial and non-commercial audiocassette tapes, CDs, DVDs, and VHS tapes mostly relating to prominent figures in the macrobiotic and alternative medicine community. To a smaller extent the collection contains correspondence and photographs from friends, family, and clients. The collection also contains patient files documenting Yamamoto's consultations and treatments for patients with various ailments.

Collection materials include research files, notebooks, conference and workshop packets, photographs, correspondence, recipes, clippings, books, magazines, pamphlets, patient files, audio and video recordings. Some of the materials are in Japanese. The materials date from 1965 to 2010.

physdesc.extent: in 12 record cartons, 1 manuscript box, 1 card box, and 1 flat file folder.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor. Paper materials are listed first, followed by audio and video recordings, and two objects are listed at the end.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I: Research Files contains Yamamoto's research materials on shiatsu, macrobiotics, yoga, and alternative, non-Western healing methods. Research files consist of notebooks, conference and workshop packets, printed material, recipes, clippings, audio and video recordings. The audio and video recordings consist of commercial and non-commercial audiocassette tapes, CDs, DVDs, and VHS tapes. The content of most of the audiovisual materials pertains to prominent figures within the macrobiotic and alternative medicine community such as Michio Kushi, George and Lima Ohsawa, and Louise Hay. The content of several of the VHS tapes is unknown due to lack of labels. Some of the materials in Series I are in Japanese. Materials date from 1965 to 2010.

physdesc.extent: in 12 record cartons and 1 flat box.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II: Books and Magazines contains publications from Yamamoto's library pertaining to shiatsu, macrobiotic living and cooking, yoga, nutrition, acupuncture, and alternative non-Western healing methods. Some of the books are authored by Yamamoto herself, including Barefoot Shiatsu,The Shiatsu Handbook, andWhole Health Shiatsu. Other book authors prominently represented within the series include Edward Esko, Wendy Esko, Louise Hay, Alex Jack, Aveline Kushi, Michio Kushi, Patrick McCarty, George Ohsawa, and Lima Ohsawa. The most common magazine titles within the series are Amberwaves, AOBTA Pulse (American Organization for Bodywork Therapies of Asia), Christina Cooks, Compas, Healthways, Ignoramus, Macrobiotics Today, Macrobiotique, and Vegetarian Times. Some of the books and magazines are in Japanese. Materials date from 1968 to 2008.

did.abstract: The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III: Correspondence and Photographs contains Yamamoto's personal and professional correspondence with family, friends, and clients. The series also contains personal photographs with a small amount of professional photographs from workshops or events Yamamoto attended. Some of the correspondence is written in Japanese. Materials date from 1965 to 2007.

did.unittitle: Correspondence regarding donations for The Macrobiotic Center of New York
Roma, Parma, and Saltburg correspondence and photographs

physdesc.extent: in 6 card boxes and 1 manuscript box.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Series IV. Patient Files contain sensitive data. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu for more information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series IV: Patient Files contains the files Yamamoto created for patients she consulted and treated for various ailments. The files consist of index cards with patients' contact information and reason(s) for consultation. The materials contain sensitive data and researchers wishing to view these materials should contact fales.library@nyu.edu for more information. Materials date from 1977 to 2002.
